result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.descr: Waiver of time limits for preliminary hearing

records.addlTxt:
1:38 PM - case called.  Defendant Jeffrey Lujon La Barge appeared by video, in custody from the Lincoln County Jail.  Attorney Werner Erich Scherr in court for Jeffrey Lujon La Barge.  Attorney Kristopher R Ellis in court for State of Wisconsin.  State has filed an Amended Criminal Complaint.  Statement by Atty Scherr - in receipt of Amended Criminal Complaint - waive reading - requests bond modification.  Response by Atty Ellis.  Court amends the cash bond to a signature bond with the same bond conditions.  Atty Scherr waives time limits.  Court accept waiver of time limits.
Scheduling conference scheduled for July 21, 2022 at 11:00 am.
